body_html: If you are not going to support predict_proba, I suppose that is okay. But every scikit-learn model that I've ever seen returns a scalar class index per prediction when predict is called on a model. Not a vector of probabilities like tflearn is currently doing. You can easily get to the prediction class using an argmax, but it makes it difficult to make TF models interchangeable with other scikit-learn models since the shape of a TF classification is different than any other scikit-learn model.

You can easily get to the prediction class using an argmax, but it makes it difficult to make TF models interchangeable with other scikit-learn models since the shape of a TF classification is different than any other scikit-learn model.
body: If you are not going to support predict_proba, I suppose that is okay.  But every scikit-learn model that I've ever seen returns a scalar class index per prediction when predict is called on a model.  Not a vector of probabilities like tflearn is currently doing. You can easily get to the prediction class using an argmax, but it makes it difficult to make TF models interchangeable with other scikit-learn models since the shape of a TF classification is different than any other scikit-learn model.
